"Money is a good servant, but a poor master."
 
 "You can't turn back the clock. But you can wind it up again."
 
 "Try to be like the turtle - at ease in your own shell."
 
 "Sow an act and you reap a habit. Sow a habit and you reap a character. Sow a character and you reap a destiny."
 
 "It is not because things are difficult that we do not dare, it is because we do not dare that they are difficult."
 
 "Every time I close the door on reality, it comes in through the window."
 
 "Habit is either the best of servants or the worst of masters."
 
 "Think all you speak, but speak not all you think."
 
 "The person who insists upon seeing with perfect clearness before he decides, never decides."
 
 "In the long run the pessimist may be proved right but the optimist has a better time on the trip."
 
 "If you want people to improve, let them hear the nice things you say about them to others."
 
 "The great end of life is not knowledge but action."
 
 "The aim of education is to teach us how to think, not what to think."
 
 "Any time a man takes a stand, there will come a time when he'll be tested to see how firm his feet are planted."

how about
 
 'do not speak unless to improve on silence' 
 
 nothing implied.
 
 
 One day a Brahmin met the Buddha.
 'Are you a priest' said the Brahmin
 'No' replied the Buddha
 'Are you a Magician'
 'No'
 'Are you a God'
 'No'
 'What are you then'
 'I am awake'

"Money implies poverty"
 
 "In the land of the blind, the one eyed man is king"
 
 "You learn more by asking the question than by knowing the answer"
 
 "Eagles may soar, but weasels don't get sucked into jet engines"
